text: Coz Cosmogony - Yeah it as an approach called "Cultural Iconoclasticism"..beyond that also. It seems you understand to a degree. It began in most practical manifestation as the French Situationalist movement in mid-1900's. It is very counter-status quo, and trans-ideological. And therefor, easily misunderstood.

text: how did they come up with this? like they woke up from the most tragic dream that they had and wrote it down? i think i've commented on this before but the thumbnail and song just nailed it -- serge asleep and kid reminiscing an emotional memory on a tropical island at night by firelight. too good... 'atmospheric' is an understatement for this game. also didn't notice initially that she had her dagger out, almost on defense-instinct, while reflecting on these memories

text: The melody is absolutely catchy and at the same time it's very Emotional, like this is the Music that plays when you remember some sad times, at the same time you stayed strong and didn't let those doubts get to you, it's like..The Stars are your memories, and your the girl, Star Stealing Girl, you steal important stars that you love, that you want to remember, then you also carry the other stars, the other stars are your Sad times, you choose to forget it, but at the same time you want to remember them, no life is perfect, and the mistakes you've made in your past is what shapes who you are, it is what shapes you to know which is Right or Wrong, I absolutely adore this, Yasunori Mitsuda is a magnificent Composer, I don't know this game but I'd love to hear some more Soundtracks and Music from this game.

author: MrKushGuy

text: It's a good game if you don't go into it expecting Chrono Trigger 2. It put alot of people off in that the main characters from Trigger aren't in the game in a playable sense, but instead their actions paved the way for this games storyline to play out. And despite the Chrono name there is no time travel, instead you go between parallel worlds. combat system is a bit different in that it's a more traditional rpg style instead of the timed rangey kinda fights in Trigger, probably due to the fact that it's a 3d game instead of sprites, and a damn pretty one for the ps1 at that.

text: I'd play this song in a no-fault divorce court (Shocking all uptight people in proccess). I'd try it if anyone ever tried to do such a selfish thing 2 me. Maybe everyones heart would soften, in speculative theory. Heh. Yeaaah riighht eh? Maybe in an ideal moral utopia itd be an effective unorthodox tactic, in such an typically shallow scenario labeled quiickly as "Irreconcilable Differences". There are def legitimate reasons to break sacred oaths, obviously. But. It is too trivially and methodically (ruthlessly) done in today's principle-less cultural\fickle attitude, masquerading as "strength".

author: Skanner 1730

text: That's how I am with Chrono Trigger! Love them both.¬†
author: Kevin Thomson

text: @Kevin Thomson¬†@Steve D¬†If you guys like the music to the two Chrono games, you will definitely like the music to Xenogears. Same composer. Not to mention, much like Chrono Trigger and Cross, Xenogears was another odd game that went forth and asked philosophical questions. One of my favorite quotations from it is when Krelian says, "If God doesn't exist in our world, then I will create God with my own hands!" It's a very insightful statement, if only you pay attention to the value it may have in our own historical retrospect. But either way, the soundtrack is a real gem.
author: Ulen Grau

text: Xenogears is one of the best Jrpgs of all time. ^    : ) Chrono Trigger\Cross rivals it, however.

author: Kacey Le

text: No problem K.  : ) I believe of its relevance philosophically and metaphysically (Qabbalah 4 example), but simply cannot because I am a Christian, (Though not a fan of organized religion itself overall, so value the games plot premise, still. Believing in reincarnation is very tempting. I definitely believe in Jungian archetypes, though) in my ultimate faith system. Unlike most of them, was once an agnostic though. So it is easier 2 critically think and have an open mind, as far as trancsending the prismatic strictures of ideologues, both secular and non-secular. Basically. It is good to recognize value in differing belief systems, regardless.

author: North Blue Star

text: Krelian had quite an interesting speech prior to his demise at Lacan's hands. He had a point or two regarding human free will, of ordinary varieties\predictable types (Unlike Fei, whom mastered his Id, also literally kind of ) . Anyway, Krelian was rather morally twisted by then, though But he was good\had a intact conscience), once upon a time. He became villainous over a bunch of Fei`s lifetimes. A vicious fixation on lust for power especially via nanotechnology and a reason to become a callously manipulative antagonist figure, make his meannns to an desired end, certainly totally deplorable. I doubt he believed he was "Playing god", as he was the shepherd of the shepherds (Gazel\Cain\Gebler) of the surface dwelling lambs, as Solarians referred to the wels they likely ate 4 breakfast meat, he didn't see he was selfishly usurping Zohar, Wave Existence, and Miangified Elhaym, just to be used himself by his own idiosyncracies. He was deluded he was serving "YHWY" (The deity he admonished Lacan for choosing human love over Krelian's concept of divine love\urge for raw spiritual belonging). Deus was originally called Yahweh, but changed due to P.R. related controversy last minute in production.

text: GameBeatenakaKevinS Hope you finally beat them little shits.  Pay attention to their elements, heal before you drop below 1/2 HP (dedicate a healer), and hit them with everything you got.  You could also backtrack a little to try and raise your stats.
